# CMSNext (Case Tracking Platform)

> Local-first case management app built with React + TypeScript. This file provides a fast index for LLM-based review tools.

## Project Summary

- App type: local-first SPA (no backend required)
- Storage: File System Access API via provider/service stack
- Architecture: domain (pure) -> services -> hooks -> components -> contexts
- Testing: Vitest + RTL

## Start Here

- README.md
- .github/copilot-instructions.md
- docs/development/ROADMAP_FEB_2026.md

## Architecture Guides

- .github/implementation-guide.md
- .github/ui-guide.md
- .github/testing-guide.md
- .github/agents/STORAGE.md
- .github/agents/HOOKS.md

## Core Entry Points

- App.tsx
- components/providers/AppProviders.tsx
- contexts/FileStorageContext.tsx
- contexts/DataManagerContext.tsx
- utils/DataManager.ts

## Domain and Services

- domain/
- utils/services/

## Active Quality/Remediation Context

- docs/audit/sonarcloud-cloud-issues-summary.md
- docs/audit/sonarcloud-open-issues.json
- docs/development/ROADMAP_FEB_2026.md

## Review Priorities

1. Preserve provider dependency order and context contracts.
2. Keep domain layer pure (no React, no I/O).
3. Route mutations through DataManager/services.
4. Maintain local-first storage behavior and notifications.
5. Keep changes test-covered and build-clean.
